title: Between Two Turrets - Come Chat with Jynx [COMPLETED]
body:
http://i.imgur.com/KjLLZy6.png
 
Welcome to the latest installment of Between Two Turrets, a Q&A series through which we connect you with various Rioters to chat about League, life, and anything in between. You can expect an installment every two weeks or so, with Rioters from all over jumping in to spend some time with you on the Boards. 

This week, we've got we’ve got Creator Support Specialist (and prolific cosplayer!) Sarah "Jynx" Kulyk!

----------------------------------------

* Hey Everyone! I need to head back to work now, but will return later to answer some more questions. Thank you so much taking the time to chat with me today!


Hi Friends!

My name is Sarah, also known as ‘Jynx’ (no relation to the Loose Cannon). I’m Canadian, and work with the Creator Support Team in North America, with a focus on programs and support for cosplayers and community artists. In the past I’ve also worked on NA Social Media, and the Events QA team, assisting at LCS and other League eSports events.

I’ve been at Riot for over 2 and a half years now, but before that I worked with Electronic Arts, freelanced as an artist on some indie/social games, and completed a Bachelor of Media Arts with a major in animation.

I started playing League of Legends in Season 1, and quickly fell in love with the characters and co-op gameplay. It didn’t take long for me to start creating League cosplay and fan art after that! Since then my experiences with the community have been so rewarding, and I’m thankful to be a part of such a creative group. I love that I now get to support and work with content creators each day! 

My adventure with games, cosplay and art has been a long one. I grew up as a dedicated console gamer, but now primarily play PC and Pen & Paper. I started creating art and costumes in the mid 1990’s, and have never been able to stop! Armor and weapons are my favorite things to build and theorycraft, and this is why my house is now filled with giant props and craft supplies...

Day to day I’m a bit of a hermit though, and spend a lot of time at home with my husband and 3 year old corgi St. Celestine, [who also likes to help out at Riot](http://imgur.com/hlizuJs). I love sci-fi, documentaries, obsess over Warhammer 40k a bit too much, and have a history of hoarding comics and other collectables. 

I’m looking forward to chatting more with you all, so feel free to ask some questions and I’ll try and reply as quickly as possible (sorry, I’m not the fastest typer). 

Thanks!
Jynx

replies.body: I didn't know Celestine was a formally canonized Saint! I feel foolish for petting her head and calling her a 'snoogy woogy booboo,' but at least now I can now address her properly at weddings and the papal conclave.

Indeed! You should address her by her full title, The Living Saint Celestine. 

=P
Dogehammer 40k
http://i.imgur.com/D8ortAC.png

I'm giving you the "Coolest Red Title Ever" award.

I mean, "Regional Ambassador" is a little too badass. You might need to dial it back before everything goes all slo-mo and explosive
Am I late? http://www.reactiongifs.com/r/dimi.gif
I'll be checking back over the next day to answer some more questions. =)

WHO IS YOUR FAVORITE ALL CHAT HOST

...there is one correct answer
LEAGUEBOY
YELLOW COUCH
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

I mean I really respect Blue Couch's contributions to the New Orleans jazz scene but can we conclusively say that experimental survives outside Louisiana in 2015? Blue Couch is a had-been. Yellow Couch all the way.

Are you actually wearing a Darius costume as you do this Q&A, as your tweet implies? (If so, rock on \m/)

https://twitter.com/RiotJynx/status/674695518384095233
Sadly not this time... but I did wear it to Riot for Halloween last year (when this photo was taken). ^_^

Hey Jynx!

Before we met formally for all chat, I met you at PAX East 2014 while you were in your sweet Annie cosplay and we took a picture of you! I dont know if links work, but...
http://justokgamers.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/cosplayers_annie.jpg

Anyway... You're picking a team for a community all stars match. Youtubers, mucisians, artists, cosplayers, etc.... all of them are at your disposal. Whats your 5 (wo)man dream team? Who shoutcasts?

Keep rocking! Warhammer 4 lyfe, amirite?
What's your League OTP and why is it TF/Graves?
what made you pick the name jynx as your handle?

Oddly enough, I’ve gone by the name ‘Jynx’ since I was a teenager (I thought it was edgy and unique at the time, hehe). So for the last 12 years or so I’ve used Jynx as my alias for art, games, and a nickname in general. ^_^ Though Jinx hadn’t been released yet when I stared at Riot, it just ended up being a funny coincidence that we have similar names.

I still think Jinx is an awesome champ though! (Even if I’m terrible at ADC) >_>

Hi Jynx! :) So glad you're being featured here! I have been following your career for a while, and I admire you a lot, you're an inspiration to me! 

Before you were a Rioter, you were a part of the fan community, do you think that you being part of Riot Games have changed the way people interact with you as a cosplayer? What's the best thing for you of being a Rioter? And also, will you come back to Spain so I can meet you? :)

PS: Celestine is the best <3

Hi Nullien! Thank you so much for your kind words and support. I really appreciate it!

Interesting question… I honestly haven’t noticed a huge difference, but I think that might be because a lot of people don’t know I work at Riot when I’m in cosplay. Sometimes my friends don’t even recognize me, which is always funny. And even people who do know me, have always kind!

I feel that as a Rioter, it’s a huge gift to stay connected to the community and learn from their experiences when possible. Every day I’m inspired by the amazing League cosplay from all around the world, and it’s been extremely motivating for me both creatively and professionally. 

I think my favorite aspect has been the opportunity to meet and collaborate with more creators than I ever could on my own. I’ve learned so much!

PS: I will send Celestine your love! ^_^
What's your favorite setting/game to cosplay from?
League of Legends and Warhammer 40k have been my favorite series' to cosplay. =)
Favorite 40k race?

Man... that's a tough question. I really love the Inquisition and Sisters of Battle, but Dark Eldar are also awesome! Because of our current Black Crusade campaign I'm also starting to warm to Orks and their ridiculousness though. Haha >_<
Honestly ..... I just came here to say 'sup.'
Hi! :D
are you a {{champion:122}}  main ?

I'm a big Darius fan and played him Top a lot before his changes, unfortunately I'm out of practice now. =( He's still awesome though, and I look forward to improving and playing him more next season!

Hey Jynx!

It's Giver :p I'm happy to see your move to Riot has been successful! What's been the hardest part of moving away from BC? I've thought about working at a few places in California but I don't want to move away from all my friends and Family, what prompted you to do so?

Thanks!

Great question! I was mainly prompted by the opportunity to work on League of Legends (my favorite game). Moving away from home was still a big decision for me though. I had never lived in another country before, and I was worried about many of the logistics that accompanied such a large move (housing, travel, immigration etc.). It was also nerve wracking to say goodbye to a lot of my friends, but in the end I’m so glad I did. This adventure has been extremely rewarding and a huge opportunity for personal and professional growth. Sometimes I still miss BC though. =)
Has this begun? First off, what do you do at Riot as a Content Support Specialist? Is it mostly art or is it more than that? Any recent projects you've really enjoyed?

Here’s a bit of a rundown of what we work on. ^_^

Our NA team (which is still relatively new) looks for opportunities and new ways to highlight and collaborate with content creators. Our goals are to be a resource for the community, help build connections between creators, and motivate those who are making awesome stuff! We’re also exploring ways to bring more educational content to creators, so they have the option to level up their craft. 

Overall this involves a pretty large range of content and executions. Everything from hosting a [Creator Lab](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/community-spotlight/all-chat-40-youtubers-locked-room), helping in the Cospitality Lounges, partnering with animators on a new [champion mix](https://youtu.be/zYd8D804bT0) or ‘Helmet Bro’ episode, and highlighting educational content in ‘The Climb’ articles. We also work with other teams within Riot to help them reach out to content creators and partner with the community.

Because of my background, I love working with the awesome artists and cosplayers in the community! This focus can also be a bit broad at times, but here's some examples of projects I work on: The [Fan Artist Features](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/fancreations/lXFM1iP2-fan-artist-feature-androoly), [Community Creation roundups](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/fancreations/adAu3yJf-kindred-community-creations), artist collaborations (Eg. [Gnar comics](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/community-spotlight/more-playtime-gnar), [Facebook stickers](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/community-spotlight/artists-behind-league-facebook-stickers), Poro holiday tags, Team Valentines, gamemode posters etc.), event programing for creators, social media, and some new projects that are still in the works.

Gurl, your hair looks so GOOD.

Also who is your favorite champ since that is not a question?
Your Darius cosplay was amazing.

Hey Jynx! Told you I’d stop by (this is Ian). :D Sooooo I have two questions, if that’s alright. First up, any plans on more cross-play outfits? Might I suggest fem-Graves? Hahaha Second question, when are you going to do your name-sake justice with a cosplay? Would love to see your take on Jinx or (especially) Slayer Jinx. Congrats again on being featured on the front of the client! \(^.^)/
Canada FTW

I heard Celestine's birthday was recently. HAPPY BIRTHDAY LITTLE CORGI.

That aside, what has been your favorite cosplay to ever do?

and

Will Celestine ever cosplay with you? 
CORGI QUESTIONS.

Hi Jinx, 
You might get the question a lot, but what advice would you give to somebody with an interest in cosplay but no experience creating anything like that.  I've been to gaming cons and anime expo and always thought that cosplaying looked fun but I've been intimidated my my lack of experience and the amount of work I perceive making a costume to be.
 - GentleDragon

Awesome question! Even though it was a long time ago *cough*, I remember how intimidating it was to build my frst costume, and then share it with the community I love... IN PERSON! O_O I think it will always be a bit nerve racking (or at least it still is for me), but here are some things I’ve kept in mind and learned over the years that may help you out.

First and foremost, have fun! For me cosplay is a positive and creative outlet to express myself, and share my passion for the characters/designs I love. So I always try to keep it that way (when possible)! At times I still find myself crunching for deadlines or taking on too many projects in my personal time.

I don’t believe there is a finish line when it comes to art. Even after 20 years of building, I’m still learning techniques and trying out new materials. Whereas it took me a long time to get where I am now, I know others that have had very different experiences. So learn at your own pace and be patient with yourself. I also recommend against comparing yourself to others too much. You're on your own unique journey which a lot of creators will be able to relate to, and that's awesome!

Don't be afraid to ask for help and learn from others. The online cosplay community has fostered a huge wealth of knowledge and resources! Chances are that if you Google it, you will find it. I recommend searching for tutorials using materials you’re interested in (EVA & craft foam is a great place to start IMO, and very forgiving to use). But it will also be a time investment, so allow yourself as many days, months, or years you need. Some people also work best when they have a crafting buddy! It’s always fun to have someone there to keep you company and motivate you to keep building. =)

Lastly, it’s okay to accept that your first piece might not turn out as you imagined. I remember the first cosplay I made (Sailor Moon R) had yellow tissue paper hair glued to a headband, no fingers in the gloves (because they were cut from a shirt), and everything was hot glued together because I didn’t know how to sew yet… this may be an extreme example. But still! Remember that you will learn from every project that you work on, and the chances are that each cosplay will be an improvement from the last. 

All that being said, if you don’t have the time or desire to make something from scratch, there's always the option of commissioning a cosplay from a creator or buying something pre-made. I believe that cosplay can be for everyone, whether you’re an artist or not!
Which rioter (apart from yourself) in your honest opinion has the best name?
ManWolfAxeBoss

5 short questions I hope you can answer 

Who is your main champion?

What is your favorite skin? 

Best cosplay you've ever seen?

Best looking champion in design?

how are you :3?{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

You were a freelance artist and animator before working with Riot, how did you get to the position you have now supporting other artists in a community of a game you like? Did you originally apply to be a splash artist or animator?

I grew up creating art and drawing constantly, and  even went to University for Animation. The great thing about this was that I found out I didn’t want to animate every day, haha. But after that I applied for some smaller art contracts that were directly related to my recent education. Which was great!

By the time that I applied at Riot, I had gained new experience as game QA and Development support at EA, therefore I applied for an Events QA position working with Esports and LCS. I’ve never applied for an art position within Riot, but I know my experience as an artist and connection to the community was a benefit when transitioning to my current role supporting content creators!
What has been your favorite character to cosplay and what cosplay do you really want to do next?

Hi! I'm not sure I can choose one... but some of my favorites to cosplay have been Predator, Darius, and Reaper. Mainly because they were challenging to build (therefore I learned a lot), and bad ass to RP. ^_^ The strong silent type I suppose... 

If I have time next year I'd like to finish PROJECT Fiora and Yasuo, and then tackle some Eldar (Warhammer 40k), before Noxus Poppy.

What was the most difficult part of doing Events QA, in general? 

Also, why are Corgis the best dogs?

Hey Jynx!

I met you with my Ahri friends back at PAX 2014 and snapped some polaroids with you! As a fellow Vancouverite, have you ever wanted to come back to check out the convention scene here again? It'd be awesome to meet you again for more amusing photos :D :D :D

So how does one get noticed if they're a content creator?

And predominantly, what do you look for? Art? Videos? Animation? Writing? Cosplay?

Hi!

I have a few questions for you. :3

Also your cosplays are truly, truly outrageous. If you don't mind me asking, how do you budget for them?
